Authors: Hiyori Itagaki, Yasuhide Nakamura, Tsuyoshi Hosoya
Title:
Two new records of ascomycetes from Japan, Pyrenopeziza
protrusa and P. nervicola (Helotiales, Dermateaceae)
Keywords:
Fagus crenata, ITS-5.8s rDNA, Magnolia obovata, Mollibase,
Quercus serrata
Abstract:
Two Pyrenopeziza species are described; Pyrenopeziza
protrusa and P. nervicola which are new to Japan. This study clarified
that P. protrusa is morphologically different from P. nervicola in
following points: (1) the ectal excipulum is more protruded toward the
margin, (2) the ascospores tend to be smaller, (3) the asci is
relatively longer and thinner, (4) the mycelium in cultivated colony is
composed of chlamydospore-like brown hyphae (while those of P. nervicola
form more complex structure, brown bulbil). The two species also do not
share the same hosts, and their sequences formed two independent clades
in the phylogenetic tree, suggesting that P. protrusa and P. nervicola
are distinct also from the viewpoints of ecology and phylogeny.
